results.title: Total fitness in 30 minutes a week
results.brief_description: A simple, thirty-minute-a week program for achieving physical fitness is outlined and demonstrated by Dr Laurence Morehouse and journalist Leonard Gross. The film is very specific in its training techniques for achieving total fitness. The teaching methods are direct and easy to follow

results.title: Tosca
results.creator_credit: Peter Butler, John Copley and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Recorded live at the Sydney Opera House in 1985 this lavish production of Puccini’s opera stars Eva Marton as Tosca, Lamberto Furlan as her lover Cavaradossi and John Shaw as the villainous Baron Scarpia. Puccini’s tale of jealousy, love and betrayal is set against a background of the Napoleonic wars, brought vividly to life by Allan Lee’s superlative sets and John Copley’s outstanding production. The Australian Opera and Chorus is conducted by Alberto Erede.

results.title: Torvill and Dean: path to perfection
results.brief_description: Chronicles the rise of world ice-skating champions Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean. Shows eight dance routines from the World Championships in 1980, 1982 and 1983, the European championships from Budapest and the Williams and Glynn Gala in 1982.

results.title: Topsoil
results.brief_description: Tells the story of one of America’s richest treasures - the thin layer of topsoil on which the people of America depend for most of their food, clothing and other necessities of life. Topsoil takes centuries to produce; it is one of nature’s most delicate and most precious gifts; yet it may be totally destroyed in a few years by improper farming methods. This film points out the difference between the topsoil and the less productive subsoil, and ends by showing how precious topsoil may be conserved while still being used for maximum production.

results.title: Tops
results.brief_description: Tops are among man’s oldest and most popular toys. This non-narrated film features 123 spinning tops from different lands. The essence of tops is captured as the stages of their movement are displayed. The second in the unfinished trilogy of toy films (ships would have been next). Music by Elmer Bernstein.

results.title: Topology
results.creator_credit: Harold Whitaker, John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
An animated film which illustrates those properties of geometric figures or solid bodies which remain invariant under certain transformations.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
